publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5356 Ms Rosemary Byrne: Tartan Kilts Made by Scottish Companies for the Royal Regiment of Scotland—That the Parliament believes that the Royal Regiment of Scotland should use the highest quality woollen cloth for its tartan; is concerned that there is a shortage of kilts for the army at present; notes that EU rules insist on competitive international tendering for the supply of goods worth more than £300,000, which could result in the cheapest and most inferior product being chosen, and calls on the Ministry of Defence to announce when the trialling of kilts for the Royal Regiment will end and to ensure that every consideration is given to the contract to supply kilts to the Royal Regiment of Scotland being kept in Scotland. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*, Dr Jean Turner*
